intro: Anoplophytum calothyrsum, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it well adapted to harsh desert environments. Its fibrous roots allow it to store water efficiently, enabling survival during periods of drought. Anoplophytum calothyrsum plays a vital role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
